tit.cmt: 条約は一つだけではないので複数形が適切です。

sen.j: 条約改正（じょうやくかいせい）とは、安政年間に日本と諸外国との間で結ばれた不平等条約を改正するための外交交渉をさす。
sen.e: Revision of a treaty means diplomatic negotiations to revise the unequal treaty which was concluded between other foreign countries and Japan in Ansei era.
Revision of treaties means diplomatic negotiations to revise the unequal treaties which were concluded between other foreign countries and Japan in Ansei era.
sen.cmt: 不平等条約は一つだけではないので複数形が適切です。
sen.e: Revision of treaties means diplomatic negotiations to revise the unequal treaties which were concluded between other foreign countries and Japan in Ansei era.

sen.j: 江戸時代後期に、たびたび日本へ来航して鎖国を行う日本に通商や国交を求める諸外国に対し、江戸幕府は1859年（安政6年）に安政五カ国条約（アメリカ合衆国、ロシア、オランダ、イギリス、フランスとの通商条約）を結ぶ。
sen.e: In the second half of Edo Period, Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) concluded a treaty called the Treaty with 5 countries (the United States of America, Russia, the Netherlands, England, and France) in Ansei era in 1859, those countries came to nationally isolated Japan by the sea frequently to request commerce and diplomatic relations.

In the second half of Edo Period, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) concluded a commercial treaty in 1859 with each of the countries which had frequently come to nationally isolated Japan by the sea to request commerce and diplomatic relations (that is, the United States of America, Russia, the Netherlands, England, and France), and those treaties were called the Treaty with the Five Countries in Ansei Era.
sen.cmt: 「幕府」には後で冠詞をつけているので、ここも統一します。「安政五カ国条約」とは一つの条約の呼称ではないので、関係性が分かりやすいよう英文表現を変更します。副詞frequentlyはこの構文では動詞の直前に置く方が自然であり、修飾関係が明白になります。
sen.e: In the second half of Edo Period, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) concluded a commercial treaty in 1859 with each of the countries which had frequently come to nationally isolated Japan by the sea to request commerce and diplomatic relations (that is, the United States of America, Russia, the Netherlands, England, and France), and those treaties were called the Treaty with the Five Countries in Ansei Era.

sen.j: 五カ国条約は関税自主権が無く、領事裁判権を認めたほか、片務的最恵国待遇条款を承認する（一説には一般の日本人の海外渡航を認める気がなかった幕府側からの要請とする説もある）内容であった。
sen.e: The 5 countries-treaty had no tariff autonomy, admitted consular jurisdiction, and approved the one-sided most favored nation clause (there is an opinion that it was a request by bakufu which had no intention to admit the people to go abroad.)

Those Five-Countries Treaty did not grant Japan tariff autonomy but admitted consular jurisdiction of the other countries, and approved the one-sided most favored nation clause for the benefit of the other countries (which is said to have been requested by the bakufu, which had no intention to admit the Japanere general public to go abroad).
sen.cmt: 直訳では条約当事者の関係性が表現できないので、「誰の」関税自主権であり領事裁判権であるかを英文中に明記します。
sen.e: Those Five-Countries Treaty did not grant Japan tariff autonomy but admitted consular jurisdiction of the other countries, and approved the one-sided most favored nation clause for the benefit of the other countries (which is said to have been requested by the bakufu, which had no intention to admit the Japanere general public to go abroad).

sen.j: この条約が尊皇攘夷運動を活性化させることになり、これが討幕運動につながることになった。
sen.e: This treaty triggered the activation of Revere the Emperor and expel the barbarians' movement, and led to the movement to overthrow the bakufu.
The treaties triggered the activation of "Revere the Emperor and expel the barbarians" movement, and led to the movement to overthrow the bakufu.
sen.cmt: 尊皇攘夷運動は、日本文には『』がついていませんが、この英文の場合は歴史上の固有の運動であることを示すために" "でくくる方が分かりやすいです。
sen.e: The treaties triggered the activation of "Revere the Emperor and expel the barbarians" movement, and led to the movement to overthrow the bakufu.

sen.j: 江戸幕府が王政復古 (日本)により倒れると、薩摩藩・長州藩を中心に成立した明治政府は幕府から外交権を引き継いだが、戊辰戦争の終結によって明治政府が日本の正統な政府であることが諸外国に認められると、1869年2月4日（明治元年12月23日_(旧暦)）に明治政府は江戸幕府が勅許を得ずに締結した条約には問題がある点を指摘し、将来的な条約改正の必要性を通知した。
sen.e: The Edo bakufu was fell down by the Restoration of Imperial Rule (Japan), the Meiji government made by the domains of Satsuma and Choshu mainly succeeded the diplomatic right from the bakufu, and Meiji government was admitted by foreign countries as legitimate government after the end of the Boshin War, then Meiji government noticed in February 4, 1869 the necessity of treaty revision in the future pointing that the treaty that the Edo bakufu concluded without the admission of the Emperor had some problems.

When the Edo bakufu was overthrown in the Restoration of Imperial Rule (Japan), the Meiji government, mainly established by the domains of Satsuma and Choshu, took over the control over the diplomacy from the bakufu, and when the Meiji government was accepted by foreign countries as a legitimate government of Japan after the end of the Boshin War, it announced on February 4, 1869 that the it was necessary to revise the treaties in the future, pointing out that treaties concluded by the Edo bakufu without the admission of the Emperor had some problems.
sen.cmt: fall downは自動詞句ですので受動態にはなりません。「外交権」をdiplomatic rightと直訳しても英語として意味を成しません。「（正当性を）認められる」はadmitよりacceptの方が自然です。他動詞notifyは通知する《相手》を目的語にとりますので、この用法は不適です。日付に対する前置詞はinではなくonです（以下同様）。「指摘する」はpoint outです。
sen.e: When the Edo bakufu was overthrown in the Restoration of Imperial Rule (Japan), the Meiji government, mainly established by the domains of Satsuma and Choshu, took over the control over the diplomacy from the bakufu, and when the Meiji government was accepted by foreign countries as a legitimate government of Japan after the end of the Boshin War, it announced on February 4, 1869 that the it was necessary to revise the treaties in the future, pointing out that treaties concluded by the Edo bakufu without the admission of the Emperor had some problems.

sen.j: この条約は1872年（明治5年）から改正交渉に入ることとなっていたため、1871年（明治4年）岩倉使節団が欧米に派遣された。
sen.e: As this treaty was going to be negotiated for the revision from 1872, IWAKURA Mission was dispatched to the United States and Europe in 1871.
As these treaties were scheduled to be negotiated for the revision from 1872, Iwakura Mission was dispatched to the United States and Europe in 1871.
sen.cmt: 《物》を主語にしてbe going to～を用いるのは不自然です。またbe going to～は口語的に過ぎます。
sen.e: As these treaties were scheduled to be negotiated for the revision from 1872, Iwakura Mission was dispatched to the United States and Europe in 1871.

sen.j: 従来この使節派遣の目的は、条約改正の打診であったといわれてきたが、実情は国法や近代的社会制度の整備が遅れていることから、改正時期の延期を諸外国に求めるものであったという学説が一般的になってきている。
sen.e: Traditionally the purpose of the dispatch of the mission was considered to be an approach for the treaty revision, but in fact, the theory that they were going to ask the foreign countries to postpone the time of the revision due to the delay of improvement of the state law and the modern social system was widely known.

The purpose of the dispatch of the mission was traditionally considered to be an approach for the treaty revision, but now it is commonly believed that in fact the mission intended to request the foreign countries to postpone the time of the revision due to the delay of improvement of the state law and the modern social system in Japan.
sen.cmt: 「という学説が一般的になってきている」を直訳すると分かりにくいのでnow it is commonly believed thatと意訳します。
sen.e: The purpose of the dispatch of the mission was traditionally considered to be an approach for the treaty revision, but now it is commonly believed that in fact the mission intended to request the foreign countries to postpone the time of the revision due to the delay of improvement of the state law and the modern social system in Japan.

sen.j: 1878年（明治11年）には、外務卿寺島宗則が西南戦争後の財政難のため税権回復を中心に交渉し、駐米公使の吉田清成とアメリカのエバーツ国務長官との間で税権回復の新条約（吉田・エバーツ条約）を調印するが、イギリス及びドイツの反対と法権の優先を求める世論の反対で挫折する（アメリカとの条約は他国と同内容の条約を結ぶことが条件になっていたため、発効しなかった）。
sen.e: In 1878, Gaimukyo (chief of Foreign Ministry) Munenori TERASHIMA negotiated mainly for the recovery of tax rights for the financial difficulty after the Seinan War, Minister to the United States Kiyonari YOSHIDA and EVERTS Secretary of State of the United States signed a new treaty of the recovery of tax rights (YOSHIDA-EVERTS Treaty), however it was failed because of the objection of England and Germany and the public opinions that required the priority of legislative rights (the treaty with the United States was to conclude the same treaty with other countries, so that the treaty was not come into effect.)

In 1878, Gaimukyo (chief of Foreign Ministry) Munenori TERASHIMA negotiated mainly for the recovery of tariff autonomy, backed by the financial difficulty after the Seinan War, and Minister-Counselor to the United States Kiyonari YOSHIDA and EVERTS Secretary of State of the United States signed a new treaty of the recovery of tariff rights (YOSHIDA-EVERTS Treaty), but it was failed because of the objection of England and Germany and the public opinions that required the recovery of jurisdiction to be prioritized (the treaty with the United States did not come into effect because it was conditional on conclusion of similar treaties with the other countries).
sen.cmt: 「財政難のため」は「財政難を背景として」という意ですのでforだけでは不十分です。公使はMinister-Counselorとします。「法権の優先を求める」は「裁判権の回復を優先することを求める」と説明的に訳した方が分かりやすくなります。文末の（ ）内の英文では日本文の意が表現できていません。
sen.e: In 1878, Gaimukyo (chief of Foreign Ministry) Munenori TERASHIMA negotiated mainly for the recovery of tariff autonomy, backed by the financial difficulty after the Seinan War, and Minister-Counselor to the United States Kiyonari YOSHIDA and EVERTS Secretary of State of the United States signed a new treaty of the recovery of tariff rights (YOSHIDA-EVERTS Treaty), but it was failed because of the objection of England and Germany and the public opinions that required the recovery of jurisdiction to be prioritized (the treaty with the United States did not come into effect because it was conditional on conclusion of similar treaties with the other countries).

sen.j: 1885年（明治18年）に太政官制度が廃止され内閣_(日本)制度が発足。
sen.e: The System of Great Council of State was abolished and the Cabinet system (Japan) was established in 1885.
The System of Great Council of State was abolished and the Cabinet system (Japan) was established in 1885.
The System of Great Council of State was abolished and the Cabinet system (Japan) was established in 1885.

sen.j: 条約改正は明治憲法制定と同時並行で取り組まれ、伊藤博文内閣の外相井上馨は鹿鳴館に代表される欧化政策を行いつつ交渉を進めた。
sen.e: The revision of a treaty was carried out with the establishment of the Meiji Constitution at the same time, the Foreign Minister Kaoru INOUE of Hirobumi ITO Cabinet negotiated by doing the policy of Europeanization such as the construction of Rokumeikan.

The revision of treaties was carried out in concurrence with the establishment of the Meiji Constitution, and the Foreign Minister Kaoru INOUE of the Hirobumi ITO Cabinet engaged in negotiation while promoting the policy of Europeanization such as the construction of Rokumeikan (Deer-cry Hall).
sen.cmt: 「…と同時に」はin concurrence with…とします。Cabinetに定冠詞をつけます。「欧化政策を行うことによって交渉した」ではないのでby + 動名詞では不適切です。「鹿鳴館」の説明を追加します（用語集を参照しました）。
sen.e: The revision of treaties was carried out in concurrence with the establishment of the Meiji Constitution, and the Foreign Minister Kaoru INOUE of the Hirobumi ITO Cabinet engaged in negotiation while promoting the policy of Europeanization such as the construction of Rokumeikan (Deer-cry Hall).

sen.j: 1886年（明治19年）、井上は東京において諸外国の使節団と改正会議を行うが、井上案は関税の引き上げや外国人判事の任用など譲歩を示したため、政府内で農商務大臣谷干城や法律顧問ギュスターヴ・エミール・ボアソナードらからの反対意見を受けた。
sen.e: In 1886, INOUE held the conference of revision with the delegation of the foreign countries in Tokyo, and suggested an appeasement plan such as to raise the customs and to appoint foreign judges, so that he had objections by the Minister of Agriculture and Commerce Tateki TANI and the advice of Law Gustave Emile BOISSONADE in the government.

In 1886, INOUE held the conference of revision with the delegation of the foreign countries in Tokyo, and proposed an appeasement plan such as to raise tariffs and to appoint foreign judges, so that he was opposed by the Minister of Agriculture and Commerce Tateki TANI and the government counsel Gustave Emile BOISSONADE.
sen.cmt: 案を「提案する、提示する」はproposeの方が適切です。Have objectionは「反対を受けた」ではなく「異議がある」ですので、意味が逆になってしまいます。
sen.e: In 1886, INOUE held the conference of revision with the delegation of the foreign countries in Tokyo, and proposed an appeasement plan such as to raise tariffs and to appoint foreign judges, so that he was opposed by the Minister of Agriculture and Commerce Tateki TANI and the government counsel Gustave Emile BOISSONADE.

sen.j: 翌1887年（明治20年）、国民がこの案を知るところとなると、折からノルマントン号事件（1886年）で不平等条約の弊害が問題になっていたため、世論は激昂してこれを「国辱的な内容」と攻撃、全国的な民権運動が盛り上がった（三大事件建白運動）。
sen.e: The next year in 1887, when the people knew the scheme, the public opinion got angry furiously in addition to the adverse effect by the unequal treaty which gave a question at Normanton Incident (in 1886), and they attacked saying 'national disgraceful treaty' then the nationwide people's rights movement was spread (the Allegation Movement of the three major incidents).

In the next year, 1887, when people knew the proposal, they got furious (especially so because adverse effects of an unequal treaty were being discussed after the Normanton Incident [1886]) and attacked the proposal claiming that it was 'national disgrace,' and then the nation-wide democratic-rights movement was spread (the movement following sandaijiken-kenpaku [the petition for three major matters]).
sen.cmt: 前置詞inの位置を修正しました。「折から…問題になっていたため」の日本文の内容が英文に適切に反映されていませんでしたので修正しました。
sen.e: In the next year, 1887, when people knew the proposal, they got furious (especially so because adverse effects of an unequal treaty were being discussed after the Normanton Incident [1886]) and attacked the proposal claiming that it was 'national disgrace,' and then the nation-wide democratic-rights movement was spread (the movement following sandaijiken-kenpaku [the petition for three major matters]).

sen.j: 条約改正交渉は中止となり、井上は辞任した。
sen.e: The negotiation of revision of a treaty was cancelled,.INOUE resigned.
The negotiation for revision of the treaties was suspended and INOUE resigned.
sen.cmt: 「…のための交渉」ですからnegotiation forとなります。条約は複数です。文と文をつなぐ接続詞が必要です。
sen.e: The negotiation for revision of the treaties was suspended and INOUE resigned.

sen.j: 黒田清隆内閣の外相大隈重信は1888年（明治21年）に交渉を再開するが、外国人を大審院に任用するなどの譲歩案がイギリスのロンドンタイムズに掲載されて日本へも伝わると、世論からは激しい批判がわき上がった。
sen.e: The Foreign Minister Shigenobu OKUMA in the Kiyotaka KURODA Cabinet restarted the negotiation in 1888, but once the package of concessions such as to appoint foreigners to the Supreme Court of Law was appeared in London Times in England, the public opinions criticized it severely.

The Foreign Minister Shigenobu OKUMA in the Kiyotaka KURODA Cabinet restarted the negotiation in 1888, but once the package of concessions including appointment of foreigners in the Supreme Court of Law was reported in London Times in England and communicated to Japan, the Japanese general public criticized it severely.
sen.cmt: appearは自動詞ですので受動態にはしません。「日本へも伝わる」が訳出されていません。
sen.e: The Foreign Minister Shigenobu OKUMA in the Kiyotaka KURODA Cabinet restarted the negotiation in 1888, but once the package of concessions including appointment of foreigners in the Supreme Court of Law was reported in London Times in England and communicated to Japan, the Japanese general public criticized it severely.

sen.j: 大隈は改正案に反対する右翼団体の団員から爆裂弾を投げつけられ右脚切断の重傷を負い、これが原因で黒田内閣は崩壊、改正交渉はまたしも挫折した。
sen.e: OKUMA was attacked by a member of the right-wing group who opposed to the revise plan, thrown an explosive bomb and seriously injured loosing his right leg and this incident caused the collapse of KURODA Cabinet, then the revise negotiation failed again.

OKUMA was attacked with an explosive bomb by a member of the right-wing group who opposed to the revision plan and was seriously injured, losing his right leg, which led to the collapse of the KURODA Cabinet and ended the revision negotiation again.
sen.cmt: throwは二重目的語をとりませんのでthrown an explosive bombという分詞構文は意味をなしません。
sen.e: OKUMA was attacked with an explosive bomb by a member of the right-wing group who opposed to the revision plan and was seriously injured, losing his right leg, which led to the collapse of the KURODA Cabinet and ended the revision negotiation again.

sen.j: しかし1888年11月30日には駐米公使兼駐メキシコ公使だった陸奥宗光が、メキシコ日本との関係との間にアジア以外の国とは初めての平等条約である日墨修好通商条約を締結することに成功する。
sen.e: However, in November 30, 1888, the Minister to the United States and Mexico Munemitsu MUTSU succeeded the conclusion of the Mexican-Japanese Treaty of Amity and Commerce, which was the first equal treaty apart from the Asian countries.

However, on November 30, 1888, the Minister-Counselor to the United States as well as to Mexico Munemitsu MUTSU succeeded in the conclusion of the Mexican-Japanese Treaty of Amity and Commerce, which was the first equal treaty apart from those with the Asian countries.
sen.cmt: 「…に成功する」という場合は前置詞inが必要です。「アジア以外の国とは初めての平等条約」が正確に訳出されていません。
sen.e: However, on November 30, 1888, the Minister-Counselor to the United States as well as to Mexico Munemitsu MUTSU succeeded in the conclusion of the Mexican-Japanese Treaty of Amity and Commerce, which was the first equal treaty apart from those with the Asian countries.

sen.j: 山縣有朋内閣で外相青木周蔵は法権の完全回復を目指して交渉を再開する。
sen.e: The Foreign Minister Shuzo AOKI in the Aritomo YAMAGATA Cabinet restarted the negotiation aiming at the perfect recovery of the legislative rights.
The Foreign Minister Shuzo AOKI in the Aritomo YAMAGATA Cabinet restarted the negotiation aiming at the perfect recovery of the legislative rights.
The Foreign Minister Shuzo AOKI in the Aritomo YAMAGATA Cabinet restarted the negotiation aiming at the perfect recovery of the legislative rights.

sen.j: この頃にはロシアの進出などの国際的状況においてイギリスの外交姿勢は軟化を示していたが、1891年（明治24年）の大津事件で青木が辞任に追い込まれた結果、中断を余儀なくされた。
sen.e: This time the diplomatic attitude of England was soften under the international circumstance such as the advance of Russia, AOKI was forced to resign due to the Otsu Incident in 1891, the negotiation had to be interrupted.

This time the diplomatic attitude of England was softened under the international circumstances such as the advance of Russia, but AOKI was forced to resign due to the Otsu Incident in 1891 and the negotiation was interrupted.
sen.cmt: was softenedと受動態にします。
sen.e: This time the diplomatic attitude of England was softened under the international circumstances such as the advance of Russia, but AOKI was forced to resign due to the Otsu Incident in 1891 and the negotiation was interrupted.

sen.j: 第二次伊藤内閣で、メキシコとの間に平等条約締結を成功させた陸奥宗光が外相となり、駐英公使の青木周蔵を交渉に当たらせ、1894年（明治27年）の日清戦争直前、ロシア帝国の南下に危機感を募らせていた英国と日英通商航海条約の調印に成功し、治外法権制度を撤廃させた。
sen.e: In the second ITO Cabinet Munemitsu MUTSU who succeeded the conclusion of the equal treaty between Mexico became the Foreign Minister, he requested the Minister to England Shuzo AOKI to negotiate with the country, in 1894 just before the Sino-Japanese War, he succeeded to conclude the Anglo-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation with England which heightened the sense of danger against going southward of the Russian Empire, then abolished the extraterritoriality.

Becoming a Foreign Minister in the second ITO Cabinet, Munemitsu MUTSU, who had succeeded in the conclusion of the equal treaty with Mexico, requested the Minister-Counselor to England Shuzo AOKI to negotiate with the country, and in 1894 just before the Sino-Japanese War, he succeeded to conclude the Anglo-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation with England, which heightened the sense of danger against the advance southward of the Russian Empire, and thus abolished the extraterritoriality.

Becoming a Foreign Minister in the second ITO Cabinet, Munemitsu MUTSU, who had succeeded in the conclusion of the equal treaty with Mexico, requested the Minister-Counselor to England Shuzo AOKI to negotiate with the country, and in 1894 just before the Sino-Japanese War, he succeeded to conclude the Anglo-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation with England, which heightened the sense of danger against the advance southward of the Russian Empire, and thus abolished the extraterritoriality.

sen.j: このことは後の日英同盟への布石となった。
sen.e: This led to the preparation of the Anglo-Japanese Alliance.
This led to the preparation of the Anglo-Japanese Alliance.
This led to the preparation of the Anglo-Japanese Alliance.

sen.j: 条約改正が達成されるのは日露戦争において日本の国際的地位が高まった後のことである。
sen.e: The achievement of revision of a treaty was after Japanese international rank was raised at the Russo-Japanese War.
It is after Japan's international status was elavated due to the Russo-Japanese War that the revision of the treaties was accomplished.
sen.cmt: 強調構文を用いて表します。
sen.e: It is after Japan's international status was elavated due to the Russo-Japanese War that the revision of the treaties was accomplished.

sen.j: 1911年（明治44年）、第二次桂太郎内閣の外相小村寿太郎は日米修好通商条約を改訂した日米通商航海条約に関税自主権を盛り込んだ修正条項に調印、ここに条約改正が達成された。
sen.e: In 1911, the Foreign Minister of the second Taro KATSURA Cabinet, Jutaro KOMURA signed the revised provision included tariff autonomy in the American-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation revised from the American-Japanese Treaty of Amity and Commerce, then the revision of the treaty was completed.

In 1911, the Foreign Minister of the second Taro KATSURA Cabinet, Jutaro KOMURA signed the modification provisions which included tariff autonomy in the American-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation, a revised version of the American-Japanese Treaty of Amity and Commerce, and thus the revision of the treaty was completed.
sen.cmt: 「日米修好通商条約を改訂した日米通商航海条約に関税自主権を盛り込んだ修正条項」の訳出が不適切です。
sen.e: In 1911, the Foreign Minister of the second Taro KATSURA Cabinet, Jutaro KOMURA signed the modification provisions which included tariff autonomy in the American-Japanese Treaty of Commerce and Navigation, a revised version of the American-Japanese Treaty of Amity and Commerce, and thus the revision of the treaty was completed.
